result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chase M. Uebelher in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:14 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
All files heard: 15CT304, 16CF226, 16CF332, 16CF333, 16CF334, 16CF488, 16CM16, 16CM79

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 

15CT304 Counts 1 & 3 - NO CONTEST
16CF226 Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5 - NO CONTEST
16CM79 Counts 3 & 4 - NO CONTEST
16CF488 Count 5 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CT304 Counts 1 & 3, 16CF226 Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5, 16CM79 Counts 3 & 4, .  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Dismissed: 15CT304 Count 2
Dismissed and read-in: 
16CF226 Counts 1 & 6
16CM79 Counts 1 & 2
16CF488 Counts 1 thru 4, 6 & 7
16CF332 in its entirety
16CF333 in its entirety
16CF334 in its entirety
16CM16 in its entirety

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CT304 Count 1 - 
Serve 50 days jail
2 days credit
Huber granted
After 30 days, may be served on Home Monitor if jail administration allows. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Pay fine and costs totaling $1,744.00 
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
17 months revocation
17 months IID
Court signs the Order for Half-Priced IID
Cmplete DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan. 
Provide DNA sample. 

15CT304 Count 3 -
Pay $100 fine plus costs inclduign DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 

16CF226 Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5 - 
6 month jail, STAYED on each count concurent with each count but consecutive to any other sentence he may be serving. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Engage in any counseling deemed necessary or appropriate by his agent. 
Not possess any dangerous weapon or firearm. 
Write letters of apology to the victims Mr. Kaminsky, Ms. Hantke Jennifer and Raiven Breseman. To be provided to agent within the first 120 days of probation. 
Provide 1 DNA sample. 
Count 5 - Pay $100 fine plus costs including the DNA and Drug Abuse surcharges. 
Counts 2, 3 & 4 - Costs

16CM79 Counts 3 & 4 -
9 months jail on each count, STAYED concurrent with each other but consecutive to any sentence he might be serving. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Same conditions as ordered in 16CF226 with the exception of the apology letters only ordered on 16CF266. 

16CF488 Count 5 -
6 months jail, STAYED  
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Same conditions as ordered in 16CF226 with the exception of the apology letters only ordered on 16CF266. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Any cash bond posted is to be applied to the fine and costs.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 02-15-2016 10:30 am
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license. Comply with conditions set forth already in 15CT-304 (Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober. Appear on all court dates)

Defendant Chase M. Uebelher in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CT-304 and 16CM-16.


4:50 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter in 15CT-304 is set for a plea and sentencing.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, a plea was agreed upon but then Defendant picked up further charges, 16CM-16
16CM-16 has an active warrant at this time.

Atty Knaapen suggests that matters be adjourned so charges can be consolidated.

Defendant addresses the Court, was not aware of the court date in 16CM-16.
Atty Knaapen shows Defendant a copy of the citation with the date/time. 

State hands to the Court a copy of the complaint in 16CM-16.
State requests warrant quashed at this time and have initial appearance done at this time.

16CM-16:
Defendant has received a copy of the complaint.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Court informs Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.

Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.

Matters are to track together.

State addresses bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.
cc:da w/mins - sp 01-12-16

Defendant Chase M. Uebelher not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 16CM-16 and 15TR-3271.

10:13 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Defendant does not appear.

State requests warrant with cash alternative.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders warrant for arrest, $750 cash alternative
15TR-3271 will be continued to follow 16CM-16.
